content.title: Post Graduate Scholarship for GATE/GPAT Qualified Students for Pursuing M.Tech/M.E./M.Pharm-UGC
content.details: University Grants Commission is implementing the scheme of Post Graduate Scholarship for GATE/GPAT Qualified Students for Pursuing M.Tech/M.E./M.Pharm courses (including integrated dual degree courses). The objective of the scheme is to help and attract young and talented graduate students to pursue education at the Post Graduate Level in Higher Education Institutions.
benefits: The Scholarship under the scheme is ₹12,400/- per month per student.
An annual contingency of ₹5,000/- will be given to the eligible student.
eligibility: The GATE/GPAT qualified students who have taken admission in M.E/M.Tech/M.Pharm courses and integrated dual degree programme in Central, State, Deemed, and Private Universities will be provided scholarships by UGC.
The students must be admitted as full-time scholars.
exclusions: No scholarship will be given to PG students who pass the GATE examination during the second year of study i.e. 3rd semester onwards.
Foreign students are not eligible for GATE/GPAT scholarships.
content.application_process: Online. After taking admission by the GATE/GPAT Qualified student, the University needs to submit the online claim for the first semester on the UGC online portal available at www.ugc.ac.in in the prescribed proforma.

faqs.question: What is the objective of PG scholarship scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to help and attract young and talented graduate students to pursue education at the Post Graduate Level in Higher Education Institutions.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: University Grants Commission, Government of India.

faqs.question: How much amount of scholarship is paid under scheme?
faqs.answer: The Scholarship under the scheme is ₹12,400/- per month per student.

faqs.question: How much amount of contingency is paid under scheme?
faqs.answer: An annual contingency of ₹5,000/- will be given to the eligible student.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility conditions for availing scholarship under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The GATE/GPAT qualified students who have taken admission in M.E/M.Tech/M.Pharm courses and integrated dual degree programme in Central, State, Deemed, and Private Universities will be provided scholarships by UGC.

faqs.question: Can foreign students be eligible for GATE/GPAT scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, foreign students are not eligible for GATE/GPAT scholarship.

faqs.question: Is there any compulsion for teaching activities?
faqs.answer: It will be obligatory on the part of every post graduate student to undertake 8 to 10 hours (per week) of work related to teaching and research activities as assigned to him/her by the institute.

faqs.question: Is there any condition for payment of scholarship?
faqs.answer: If a student scores below 60% in any semester he/she shall be paid a scholarship @ ₹1,550/- in that particular semester.

faqs.question: Is there any house rent admissible to the students?
faqs.answer: No house rent is admissible to M.E./M.Tech./M.Pharm students.

faqs.question: Can the scholar take any paid assignment during the tenure of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, the scholar shall not undertake any paid assignment during the tenure of the scholarship.

faqs.question: Shall the scholarship be terminated immediately if the scholar has failed in any semester?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scholarship shall be terminated immediately if the scholar has failed in any semester.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for the Scheme by the universities?
faqs.answer: After taking admission by the GATE/GPAT Qualified student, the University needs to submit the online claim for the first semester on the UGC online portal.

faqs.question: How the UGC Scholarship is being disbursed?
faqs.answer: The UGC Scholarship is being disbursed through CANARABANK UGC Portal.
